overview_of_class: This year-long course is a sequel to Chinese I (Chinese 111), designed for students who have completed Chinese 111 at Northwestern or the equivalent elsewhere. It aims to further develop students' Chinese proficiency through: (1) consolidating the foundation built in students' beginning modern Chinese courses; (2) introducing them to more complex grammatical structures, varieties of language styles, and background cultural information. Upon the satisfactory completion of the course, students will be able to handle various types of more complex daily conversational situations and multi-paragraph passages on familiar topics. This 50-minute class meets five times a week. Successful completion of CHINESE 121-3 will satisfy the WCAS foreign language requirement.
name: Chinese II
subject: CHINESE
